cyclone.name: ZETA
cyclone.current_location: about 305 mi SSE of the western tip of Cuba and 300 mi SE of Cozumel, Mexico

motion.direction: Stationary (forecast to begin moving NW within 12 h)

cyclone.trajectory: Expected to drift northwest, cross the northern Yucatán Peninsula late Monday, move into the central Gulf of Mexico Tuesday–Wednesday, then turn north-northeast and move inland over the central Gulf Coast (likely Louisiana–Mississippi) late Wednesday before accelerating toward the Tennessee Valley and Appalachians by Thursday.
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: central Gulf Coast, near the Louisiana–Mississippi shoreline

weather_observation.watch_coast: Hurricane Watch for Yucatán Peninsula (Tulum to Río Lagartos) and Tropical-Storm Warning for Pinar del Río, Cuba; no watches along the U.S. East Coast.
weather_observation.warning_coast: Hurricane Warning in effect for Tulum to Río Lagartos, including Cozumel; no warnings along the U.S. East Coast.
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Northern Yucatán Peninsula, central Gulf Coast from southeast Texas to the Florida Panhandle, inland to the Tennessee Valley and southern Appalachians.
weather_observation.rain_fall_above_4_inch: Unlikely (generally 1–3 inches with isolated 4 inches possible)
weather_observation.wind: Breezy conditions possible late Wednesday night into Thursday (gusts 25–35 mph); gale-force probability very low (≈3%).
weather_observation.storm_surge: None expected along the South Carolina coast because the center remains inland well west of the port.
weather_observation.rainfall: Bands of heavy rain are possible Thursday; most guidance shows 1–3 inches with isolated 4-inch amounts.
weather_observation.other_hazards: Isolated short-lived tornadoes in outer rain-bands cannot be ruled out on Thursday.
